comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: For some more views of the demolition see here and here The demolition was to make way for Machattie Park, which was officially opened in 1890. There are some great early images of the park here and here The date written on the photo is likely to be wrong. Most references give 1888 as the demolition date. Also, the new gaol was built in 1888.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Hi pellethepoet,  the photographs were received by State Records with no accompanying documentation so we can only go by the date that was written on the image. We are happy to change the date to 'decade of 1880's'.

comment.author: 8130912@N08
comment._content: What a wonderful old photograph ! Noticed your beaut Bathurst photo in the group pool! www.flickr.com/groups/bathurst_nsw/

comment.author: 62814976@N07
comment._content: I have been trying to locate any info on the site of the old Bathurst Gaol. It  is rumoured that the site was offered for private sale, but no one took up the offer because of the hangings that took place on the site. Machattie Park was then built on the site.
